Source Example¶

Source1 provides functions for describing a triangle.

Determining Polygon Type¶

The function source.source1.get_poly_type() provides users with a way to provide a set of four sides of a polygon and returns the type of polygon (“square”, “rectangle”, or “invalid”) or provides users with a way to provide a set of four angles and returns whether the polygon is a “square”, “rhombus”, or “disconnected”

Rectangle Example¶

>>> from source.source2 import get_poly_type
>>> get_poly_type(1, 2, 1, 2)
'scalene'

Rhombus Example¶

>>> from source.source2 import get_poly_type
>>> get_poly_type(135, 45, 135, 45, True)
'rhombus'

Complex Documentation¶













Module Reference¶




source.source2 – New source code¶


The following code determines if four given sides create a square, a rectangle,
or something else.





source.source2.get_poly_type(a=0, b=0, c=0, d=0, angles=False)[source]¶


Determine if the given polygon is square, rectangle, rhombus, or other







Parameters:
    

  • a (float or int or tuple or list or dict) – line a
    • 

  • b (float or int) – line b
    • 

  • c (float or int) – line c
    • 

  • d (float or int) – line d
    • 

  • angles (bool) – True if given angles
    • 






Returns:
“square”, “rectangle”, “rhombus” or “invalid”





Return type:
str
